item.title: The Negative look-behind trap -- regex
item.description: A request was made in this Daniweb thread to split a string based on punctuations and whitespaces but with a twist. The splitting should make exceptions/allowances for special cases. For e.g. let’s say we are splitting on . (the dot character). Our splitting should keep titles like Mrs. and Mr. intact. What does this mean? Let’s have a look at it with an example (for those wondering, the code snippets are in Python programming language):
